results.title: Christo's valley curtain
results.creator_credit: Albert Maysles, David Maysles, Ellen Gifford, Thomas Handloser and Maysles Films, Inc.
results.brief_description: A documentary by the Maysles Brothers focusing on the construction of a five hundred foot valley curtain by Bulgarian artist Christo. Examines the erection of the veil across Rifle Gap (part of the Grand Canyon) and presents smaller art works by Christo which were used in preparation for the event.

results.brief_description: Humourous claymation treatment on the theme of going to the movies where the audience rolls up to watch a public relations film about film. No credits available

results.title: The Atom: a closer look
results.creator_credit: Corporate Productions and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description: Uses animation and live-action to illustrate the history of atomic theory, the structure of the atom and its nucleus, how nuclear energy is generated, radiation and the problems of nuclear waste disposal. Although basically factual, the program stresses the fact that the atom is neither good nor evil, and that it is man’s responsibility to decide whether atomic power will either create or destroy. Made pre Chernobyl but an excellent introduction to atomic theory. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Overture: Linh from Vietnam
results.creator_credit: Seth Pinsker, Elaine Sperber and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Docudrama which tells about young Linh Tran and her family, who have settled into their first real home since immigrating to America from Vietnam. Discusses the social hardships they incur, the adjustments they must make to a new culture, and the girl’s friendship with a Mexican-American boy. Cast includes: Pandito Gomez, Kim Ngan Ly, Michael Leon and Stanley Brock

results.title: The Invisible children
results.creator_credit: Christopher Brough, Rift Fournier and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Presents the Kids on the Block, a unique group of puppets in that one is deaf, one blind and another in a wheelchair. They tour the country encouraging non-disabled children to ask and learn about their handicapped peers and to see the world through different eyes. Stars Gary Burghoff (from TV’s MASH) and was made during an actual classroom presentation. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Dinky Hocker
results.creator_credit: Tom Blank, Diane Asselin, Paul Asselin, Robert Guenette and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Portrays the plight of a girl who is addicted to food and whose mother is too busy to be concerned. In the face of her mother’s opposition to her attempts at dieting and with the friendship of a young man who shares her addiction, Dinky makes one last attempt to gain her mother’s attention. Based on the book “Dinky Hocker Shoots Smack” by M.E. Kerr.

results.title: Black music in America: the 70's
results.creator_credit: BMA and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: An overview of the world of black music in the 1970’s. Presents a musical journey from Motown to disco of Donna Summer. Includes clips of over seventy-five groups showing the growth and influence of black music in this decade. Narrators are Isaac Hayes and Dionne Warwick. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Hunters of the seal: a time of change
results.creator_credit: Barbara Gullahorn-Holecek, Time-Life Films and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: Contrasts the old and new ways of life of the Netsilik Eskimo. Shows how their conversion to Christianity and the efforts of the Canadian government to help them have put an end to their nomadic lifestyle. Narrated by Mercedes McCambridge. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Mole and the chewing gum
results.creator_credit: Zdenek Miler, H. Kilianove, H. Mauricova, J. Forman and Kratky Film
results.brief_description: An animated film about a mole who discovers some chewing gum and gets into a sticky situation. Story by J. A. Novotny. Music by Milos Vacek. Animated by J. Doubrava, O. Kudrnac, K. Stebl, V. Maresova, Z. Bartova and J. Vokoun.
